posts.author: Valehand
posts.content: Hello guys I was wanting help. I was trying to make a build for Arelith lv 30 cap, for paladin (attempting half elf, but wondering if that was a bad idea) My intent was a Paladin/Cleric/COT or something along those lines, but I need expert advice to help me see if this is a good thing to multi class in thanks!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Hi Valehand,

If you go with high (uber) saves, i would go with a (Cleric 17/ Paladin 3/ CoT 10) perhaps, with a descent enough Charisma and take DM/DS as well.

posts.author: Valehand
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:
Hi Valehand,

If you go with high (uber) saves, i would go with a (Cleric 17/ Paladin 3/ CoT 10) perhaps, with a descent enough Charisma and take DM/DS as well.
High uber saves? Would you mind elaborating for me, Valerfor?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Well, Paladin gives you (Cha mod. to Saves) plus immunities to disease and fear. Champion Of Torm will give you another (+5) universal to your saving throws and both Cleric and CoT have 2 out of 3 good saves. If you want to take advantage of this, the natural way is to go for a split Charisma/ Wisdom build Or Charisma/ Strength, depending upon the weapon chosen (Longbow w/Zen Archery for wisdom Or Longsword for strength) and since you are there, you should also take Divine Might/ Divine Shield as well. It's just the natural flow, or else you have no reason at all to take Paladin levels in this build.

I see... well when I started. I thought I knew a bit more than this, but even I didn't know that. Er, I'm gonna do a cheesy quote thing. Valerfor with your knowledge so bright, won't you help me build a paladin right?

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Some more information: The saves boost from CoT levels counts towards the +20 limit on saves boosts (from items, Spellcraft, and such), but the Paladin CHA saves boost does not.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Sure man, give me a day and you will have a divine archer with uber saves!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Here you go Valehand, the build turned-out better than i expected, having some serious punch and saves that inspire awe. Not even a super-focused implosion cleric can scare you with those saves, you will only fail in a roll of (1) on anything that can actually touch you. And that AB and AC you can achieve, heh broken clerics is all i will say... As for Domains, War is a must and then you can select between Travel (1st choice)/ Trickery (2nd choice) and Strength (3rd choice). In most Lvl 30 PW's there is no perma-haste so Travel Domain is the natural choice after War.
